Posted: July 5, 2016
												This is a pretty fun in tiny shots puzzle game. It has a similar puzzle game to puzzles & dragons series or good old bejeweled. Except in this you slide the columns or rows into 3 or more of a kind. Different puzzle pieces are how you attack or raise money and resources.        I believe this was a mobile game at first, or at least I remember playing it long ago on the mobile. Ended up with this in a humble bundle pack and didn't realize it was this game so I had the added flavor of nostalgia with my experience.        So, if you like casual puzzlers of the matching type and it's at a reasonable price, go for it!

Posted: January 25
												Truth be told, I got this game as part of the Humble PC & Android Bundle 14. Now that I actually look at the games included, I am pretty sure I had just bought it to make the donation and maybe play the games included one day. I think it took the fact that I had some 200 odd keys to redeem (many, many duplicates dating back to 2013) to get me to play this game. I just decided to start from the top of the list and work my way down. My list was sorted alphabetically so 10,000,000 was the logical starting point.At the onset, 10,000,000 seems like just another match-3 games. Add in RPG elements of upgrading your gear and abilities and you have the perfect puzzle game. I normally hate match-3 games. Beat a level only to unlock a new level just gets boring after a while. What sets 10,000,000 apart is that you are not actually beating levels. You play until you either die or run out of time. My wife happened to walk by while I was playing and so eloquently put it "it's one of those match games" and after I told her there was a time limit, "so, like tetris."  The first time I played through the game, I did so on my phone. On top of everything I mentioned, I think I enjoyed the quick games you can play. I then decided to play on Steam because, you know, achievements (such a dumb reason to play a game by the way - says the guy who got two platinum trophies for My Name is Mayo...). 10,000,000 is almost as enjoyable but I get the feeling that the game was designed for mobile. I usually do not sit at my computer to play a quick game that lasts anywhere from 20 seconds to a few minutes. I hate referring to a game I genuinely like as something to kill time but ultimately, it is one of the factors I look for in mobile games.I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a different take on the match-3 game. From its pixelated graphics and retro-style soundtrack, this is a perfect game when you need a quick break. I recommend the mobile version and not only because it costs two bucks cheaper. I loved playing a few rounds and then taking a break. The game has the tendency of being a grind and I feel this is more likely to occur on the Steam version when you are sitting down and playing longer than 5-10 minutes. The game only takes about 3-4 hours to complete. Why not make it last? As more daughter would say, "one more time!" Hopefully, you feel that way too when trying to put the game down.www.whereisthepausebutton.wordpress.com

Product received for free
 Two thumbs up 10,000,000 is a great game, and a fresh twist on match-3 games.Most significant upside: The game feels like a role-playing game, although you use match-3 to fight monsters. This gives goals to the match-3 strategy, which is a sweet, unique feel.Most significant downside: The game is still a match-3 game at heart, so it hits a strange middle-ground between casual games and more advanced role-playing games.

Posted: January 19
												The gameplay premise sounds odd: an action-RPG with puzzle-based combat. The combat/puzzle takes a little while getting used to, however, the surprisingly inventive gameplay is a satisfying experience!Simple on the surface, when you start the dungeon crawl, you'll have three objectives you can attempt to fulfill, earn resources and gold, upgrade your character, and in the end try to obtain a total score of 10,000,000 points.I never made the final objective, but I still recommend this game!

Posted: September 21, 2016
												This game isn't bad. Why is the review negative then you say? Because it's not good either, it's below average actually. The concept is great, and it could make an action-packed roguelike game, but the execution is quite bad. The game would be fine if it wouldn't be for one detail. The time doesn't pause when damage is dealt and when chains are countered (and you can't do anything at that time). This might seem like a detail, it might seem weird from a stranger's perspective but it ruins the game. How many times have I lost because the timer kept on running and combos of items I didn't need kept on coming? Way too many.In conclusion - buy the game in a bundle or when on sale, but not for anything above 2 dollars. It keeps you entertained for a while but is quite annoying.5/10

Posted: April 9
												Addictive match 3 game with a unique twist where matching the right tiles will get you further in the dungeon.There's not too much of a storyline - the goal of the game is to score 10 million points which will allow you to exit the castle.  The gameplay itself is a lot of fun though.  You run dungeons to get loot and with loot, you can upgrade your castle, your character and weapons and add challenges using the potions.Each dungeon has a set of challenges and when you completely these, you can move onto harder dungeons to get better loot.You can also pick up items along the way which will allow you to last longer in the dungeon if used wisely.It's a quick game to finish and definitely worth the money!

I then decided to play on Steam because, you know, achievements (such a dumb reason to play a game by the way - says the guy who got two platinum trophies for My Name is Mayo...). 10,000,000 is almost as enjoyable but I get the feeling that the game was designed for mobile. I usually do not sit at my computer to play a quick game that lasts anywhere from 20 seconds to a few minutes. I hate referring to a game I genuinely like as something to kill time but ultimately, it is one of the factors I look for in mobile games.I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a different take on the match-3 game. From its pixelated graphics and retro-style soundtrack, this is a perfect game when you need a quick break. I recommend the mobile version and not only because it costs two bucks cheaper. I loved playing a few rounds and then taking a break. The game has the tendency of being a grind and I feel this is more likely to occur on the Steam version when you are sitting down and playing longer than 5-10 minutes. The game only takes about 3-4 hours to complete. Why not make it last? As more daughter would say, "one more time!" Hopefully, you feel that way too when trying to put the game down.www.whereisthepausebutton.wordpress.com

Shield is needed to reduce damage and make the run longer and the chest has a chance of giving you an item. Your end goal is to reach 10M in one RUN. You do have to upgrade yourself to make a run last longer. Once you have read the left side, your game will be over!Unlocking new things.Very easy game to understand.Repetitive but addictive.You can upgrade yourself by making your runs a little bit easier.Very interesting game!Could be short if you are doing really well.The 8 bit music is very well done! Including in Combat puzzle mode!There are challenges that you should be able to complete for rewards.Other things.If you are familiar with the game "tetris attack" on the Snes or "Pokemon puzzle league" on the N64. Posted: April 25
												Name of the game? 10,000,000. Your goal? 10,000,000. Yep, it's interesting.Even though we have a strangely-named (or numbered) game title, it does seem to fit within the main game itself as you simply need to score 10,000,000 points in order to win the game. How do you score that, you may ask? Well, the game is rather simple in a way that it mixes match-3, endless runner and RPG-like elements all in one game. You match tiles in order to either gain resources, build up your shield, unlock loot, or even just kill some monsters that'll simply attack you in order to push you to the left side of the screen, which will make you lose. As you gain resources such as XP, gold, wood and stone, you use them to improve your dungeon that'll bring in many status upgrades ranging from dealing more damage when matching swords and staffs to gaining certain buffs such as gaining time bonuses when matching wood and stone.Throw in some objectives, ranks, and some score and resource multipliers, you'll be well on your way to reaching 10,000,000! It's a fun game for those who like match-3 RPGs.
